text: the Caribbean coast of Venezuela is home
to some of the world's most coveted
cacao a key ingredient in high-end
chocolate long before the country's oil
boom cacao was Venezuela's main export
but despite its superior crop the local
industry languished through the 20th
century and today accounts for less than
1% of cacao in the global market I'm
Simone Romero reporting for The New York
Times I recently traveled to villages in
the Henry piti air National Park looking

Rosenberg says that the profits from his

the nearby village of Chihuahuas proof
